channel.title: Jumping awake?
channel.description: I read somewhere that when we jump awake, from a falling dream, that a parallel you in another universe had died. Now, it could just be a concept, and I'm not totally sure if I believe in it due to the fact I jump awake at least 3-4 times a week. That would be a lot of deaths, but what im targeting is the general concept right now . What if all throughout the universe in different galaxys on different home planets that supports life, there is you. Look the same, same parents/family same area, just living differently. Thoughts ?

@Chronikk_HD wrote:

Clawz fury:

i never “jump awake” so i don’t know what you’re talking about. lay off the weed

I’m sure you have as its a natural reaction to falling dreams.

FIRST OFF NEVER ASSUME nothing is real that you know no of…its best to preassume that it is real soo u can prepare for the worst js
[/quote]“prepare for the worst” meaning what? My parallel universe self dying will cause me to die in this universe? Have you read the thread?[/quote]
it was for david i believe

item.title: Jumping awake?
item.dc:creator: @Pwnd Pwnd
item.description:
@Pwnd wrote:

So, when someone is talking in their sleep, I can’t understand them usually because they’re talking in the language of a DIFFERENT DIMENSION THEM???

ok

Read full topic

item.title: Jumping awake?
item.dc:creator: @Chronikk_HD Chronikk_HD
item.description:
@Chronikk_HD wrote:

Tutorial:

It would be easier to give valid replies if we had an actual ground to debate upon this with. We have no factual evidence that proves the existence of parallel universes, or even if they share a mutual connection of some sort, because the theory sounds absurd. I believe the best explanation anyone can give you for this occurrence during sleep is the fact that the body is most likely in the first stage of sleep, which means the body has not yet been temporarily paralyzed.

Yeah, putting it that way I understand what you’re saying. I know it’s a far out theory, but I even stated when in my first post I’m not even sure I believe in this, it was just the general concept of ‘what if’. Guess I should have clarified that in the first place.

Read full topic
